CatDescriptText: Mrs.Frances Hill, 7925 Tioga Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 30, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Does the financial aid, given young married couples by parents, encourage or dissuade the latter's realization of marital responsibilities?" answer reads: "Sometimes it helps, and sometimes it doesn't. Especially, it doesn't help in the case of some males who are spoiled, or, in other words, are tied to their mother's apron strings.  I think that they should stand on their own feet unless things get so bad that they really need the help.  And then they should get it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Frances Hill, wearing eyeglasses, light colored short sleeved striped blouse, and pinwheel patterned jumper, posed in front of store advertising tablecloths
